{{Infobox military conflict |conflict=Second Ottoman–Venetian War |image=Battle of Zonchio 1499.jpg |image_size=300px |caption=The Battle of Zonchio |partof=the [[Ottoman–Venetian Wars]] |date=1499–1503 |place=[[Adriatic Sea|Adriatic]], [[Ionian Sea|Ionian]] and [[Aegean Sea]]s |result=Ottoman victory |territory=Venetian strongholds of [[Methoni, Messenia|Modon]] and [[Koroni|Coron]] fall to the Ottomans; [[Cephalonia]] and [[Ithaca]] to Venice |combatant1={{flag|Republic of Venice}}
{{flagicon image|Flag of Cross of Burgundy.svg}} [[Catholic Monarchs|Castile and Aragon]] |combatant2=[[Ottoman Empire]] |commander1={{flagicon|Republic of Venice}} [[Antonio Grimani]]
{{flagicon image|Flag of Cross of Burgundy.svg}} [[Gonzalo de Córdoba]] |commander2=[[Kemal Reis]]
[[Feriz Beg]] }} {{Campaignbox Ottoman–Venetian Wars}} {{Campaignbox Ottoman–Venetian War (1499–1503)}} The '''Second Ottoman–Venetian War''' was fought between the [[Ottoman Empire]] and the [[Republic of Venice]] for control of the lands that were contested between the two parties in the [[Aegean Sea]], [[Ionian Sea]] and the [[Adriatic Sea]]. The war lasted from 1499 to 1503. The Turks, under the command of Admiral [[Kemal Reis]], were victorious and forced the Venetians to recognize their gains in 1503. ==The war== === 1499=== In January 1499, Kemal Res set sail from [[Constantinople]] with a force of 10 [[galley]]s and 4 other types of ships, and in July 1499 met with the huge Ottoman fleet and took over its command in order to wage a large-scale war against the [[Republic of Venice]]. The Ottoman fleet consisted of 67 galleys, 20 [[galliot]]s and about 200 smaller vessels. In August 1499, Kemal Reis defeated the [[Venetian navy]] under the command of [[Antonio Grimani]] at the [[Battle of Zonchio]] (also known as the Battle of Sapienza or the First Battle of Lepanto). It was the first naval battle in history with cannons used on ships, and took place on four separate days: on August 12, 20, 22 and 25, 1499. After reaching the [[Ionian Sea]] with the large Ottoman fleet, Kemal Reis encountered the Venetian fleet of 47 galleys, 17 galliots and about 100 smaller vessels under the command of [[Antonio Grimani]] near [[Cape Zonchio]] and won an important victory. During the battle, Kemal Reis sank the galley of Andrea Loredan, a member of the influential Loredan family of Venice. Antonio Grimani was arrested on 29 September but was eventually released. Grimani later became the [[Doge of Venice]] in 1521. The Ottoman Sultan [[Bayezid II]] gifted 10 of the captured Venetian galleys to Kemal Reis, who stationed his fleet at the island of [[Cefalonia]] between October and December 1499. Ottoman incursions into inland Dalmatia also started in 1499, under command of Isa Pasha and [[Feriz Beg]].{{Sfn|Goodwin|2013|p=104}} ===1500=== In December 1499, the Venetians attacked [[Naupactus|Lepanto]] with the hope of regaining their lost territories in the [[Ionian Sea]]. Kemal Reis set sail from Cefalonia and re-took Lepanto from the Venetians. He stayed in Lepanto between April and May 1500, where his ships were repaired by an army of 15,000 Ottoman craftsmen brought from the area. From there, Kemal Reis set sail and bombarded the Venetian ports on the island of [[Corfu]], and in August 1500 he once again defeated the Venetian fleet at the [[Battle of Modon (1500)|Battle of Modon]]. Kemal Reis bombarded the fortress of [[Methoni, Messenia|Modon]] from the sea and captured the town. He later engaged with the Venetian fleet off the coast of [[Koroni|Coron]] and captured the town along with a Venetian brigantine. From there Kemal Reis sailed towards the Island of [[Sapientza]] (Sapienza) and sank the Venetian galley ''Lezza''. In September 1500, Kemal Reis assaulted Voiussa and in October he appeared at Cape Santa Maria on the Island of [[Lefkada]], before ending the campaign and returning to Constantinople in November. With the Battle of Modon, the Turkish fleet and army quickly overwhelmed most of the Venetian possessions in [[Greece]]. Modon and Coron, the "two eyes of the Republic", were lost. [[Doge of Venice|Doge]] [[Agostino Barbarigo]] asked the Pope and the [[Catholic Monarchs]] for help, and on 24 December a [[Spain|Spanish]]–Venetian army commanded by [[Gonzalo de Córdoba]] [[Reconquest of Cephalonia|took Cephalonia]], temporarily stopping the Ottoman offensive on eastern Venetian territories. ===1501–1503=== {{Location map+|Greece|relief=yes|float=right|width=300|caption=Territorial changes of the war. Blue marks territories taken by Venice; purple by the Ottomans. |places= {{Location map~|Greece|lat=38.25 |long=20.5 |label=|mark=Blue-circle.gif}} {{Location map~|Greece|lat=38.366667 |long=20.716667 |label=|mark=Blue-circle.gif}} {{Location map~|Greece|lat=36.816667 |long=21.7 |label=|mark=Purple pog.svg}} {{Location map~|Greece|lat=36.783333 |long=21.95 |label=|mark=Purple pog.svg}} }} The Ottoman incursions in Dalmatia escalated to the point where Venice was forced to sign a treaty with [[Vladislaus II of Hungary]] and [[Pope Alexander VI]] by which they pledged 140,000 ducats a year for the [[Kingdom of Hungary]] to actively defend its southern Croatian territories, which aided the defence of Venetian Dalmatia, signed after long negotiations on 13 May 1501.{{cite journal | first = Tomislav | last = Raukar | url = http://hrcak.srce.hr/index.php?show=clanak&id_clanak_jezik=110340&lang=en | title = Hrvatska na razmeđu XV i XVI. stoljeća | language = Croatian | journal = Senjer Jahrbuch | volume = 10 | number = 1 |date=October 1990 | issn = 0582-673X | publisher = City Museum Senj – Senj Museum Society | location = [[Senj]], Croatia | page = 9 | accessdate = 2012-07-08}} In 1501 [[Feriz Beg]] captured [[Durrës|Durazzo]] in [[Venetian Albania]].{{Sfn|Press|1948|p=80}} By the end of 1502, Venice and the Ottoman Empire agreed on an armistice. On 31 January 1503, Venice signed another treaty with Vladislaus II, having already paid 124,000 ducats through the previous treaty, to pay 30,000 ducats a year for the same purpose. In 1503, Turkish cavalry raids reached Venetian territory in [[Northern Italy]], and Venice was forced to recognize the Ottoman gains, ending the war. The economy of the Venetian cities in Dalmatia was severely impacted by the Turkish occupation of the hinterland during this war.{{cite journal | first = Tomislav | last = Raukar | url = http://hrcak.srce.hr/index.php?show=clanak&id_clanak_jezik=86538&lang=en | title = Venecija i ekonomski razvoj Dalmacije u XV i XVI stoljeću | language = Croatian | journal = Journal of the Institute of Croatian History | volume = 10 | number = 1 |date=November 1977 | issn = 0353-295X | publisher = [[Faculty of Philosophy, Zagreb]] | location = Zagreb, Croatia | pages = 218–221 | accessdate = 2012-07-08}} ==Aftermath== By September 1510, Vladislaus had received a total of 116,000 ducats under the terms of the second treaty with Venice. After 1508, he had also been under pressure from the [[League of Cambrai]] to join them against Venice, but skillful Venetian diplomacy prevented that. ==See also== {{Portal|Military history of the Ottoman Empire}} * [[Ottoman Navy]] == References == {{reflist}} == Sources == * {{cite book | last=Chasiotis | first=Ioannis | chapter = Πολεμικές συγκρούσεις στον ελληνικό χώρο και η συμμετοχή των Ελλήνων |trans-chapter=Conflicts in the Greek lands and the participation of the Greeks | pages = 252–323 | script-title=el:Ιστορία του Ελληνικού Έθνους, Τόμος Ι′: Ο ελληνισμός υπό ξένη κυριαρχία, 1453–1669 |trans-title=History of the Greek Nation, Volume X: Hellenism under foreign rule, 1453–1669 | location = Athens | year = 1974 | publisher = Ekdotiki Athinon | language = Greek | ref=harv}} * {{cite book|ref=harv|last=Press|first=Illinois|title=Illinois Studies in the Social Sciences|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=jxAdAQAAMAAJ|year=1948|publisher=University of Illinois Press}} * {{cite book|ref=harv|last=Goodwin|first=Godfrey|title=The Janissaries|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=Zj8hBQAAQBAJ&pg=PT104|date=2 January 2013|publisher=Saqi Essentials|isbn=978-0-86356-781-0}} ==External links== * [https://web.archive.org/web/20070711042901/http://www2.let.uu.nl/Solis/anpt/ejos/pdf/Fisher6.pdf Sydney N. Fisher: The Foreign Relation of Turkey, 1481–1512, Chapter VI: War with Venice, 1499–1503] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20070312093110/http://www.deremilitari.org/resources/articles/dotson1.htm John E. Dotson: Foundations of Venetian Naval Strategy from Pietro II Orseolo to the Battle of Zonchio] {{DEFAULTSORT:Ottoman-Venetian War (1499-1503)}} [[Category:15th-century conflicts]] [[Category:16th-century conflicts]] [[Category:Ottoman–Venetian Wars|1499-1503]] [[Category:15th century in Greece]] [[Category:16th century in Greece]] [[Category:1499 in Europe]] [[Category:1500s in Europe]] [[Category:1500s in the Ottoman Empire]] [[Category:1499 in the Ottoman Empire]] [[Category:Ottoman–Spanish conflicts]]

{{pp-semi-indef|small=yes}} The '''Pacific Northwest tree octopus''' is an [[Internet hoax]] created in 1998 by Lyle Zapato.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://zapatopi.net/treeoctopus/ |title=Help Save The Endangered Pacific Northwest Tree Octopus From Extinction! |author=Lyle Zapato }}</ref> This fictitious endangered species of [[cephalopod]] was given the Latin name "''Octopus paxarbolis''" (the species name being coined from Latin ''pax'', the root of ''Pacific'', and Spanish ''arbol'' meaning "tree"). It was purportedly able to live both on land and in water, and was said to live in the [[Olympic National Forest]] and nearby rivers, [[spawn (biology)|spawning]] in water where its [[Egg (biology)|eggs]] are laid. Its major predator was said to be the [[Sasquatch]]. The Pacific Northwest tree octopus website is among a number of sites commonly used in [[Information literacy|Internet literacy]] classes in schools, although it was not created for that purpose. ==Internet literacy studies== Leu et al. (2007) conducted an empirical study on 13-year old US school children’s ability to critically evaluate online information for reliability.<ref>Leu, D. J., Reinking, D., Carter, A., Castek, J., Coiro, J., Henry, L. A., ... & Zawilinski, L. (2007). Defining online reading comprehension: Using think aloud verbal protocols to refine a preliminary model of Internet reading comprehension processes. ''D. Alvermann (Chair) 21st Century Literacy: What is it, How do students get it, and how do we know if they have it''.</ref> The sample included the top quartile of school children (n=53) in samples from the states of Connecticut and South Carolina. Each school child was exposed to the spoof site ''“Save The Northwest Pacific Tree Octopus''" ([http://zapatopi.net/treeoctopus]/, devoted to this rare species of octopus, complete with pictures of the animal itself and its environment. The school children then received a short, fictitious, message from another class, asking them to locate and evaluate the reliability of the website. They were to provide three reasons for their answer, and summarize the most important information from that website in one or two sentences. Then they were asked to send their information via IM, email, or to post this on a blog site. Following the activity, school chldren were interviewed to ensure that they were familiar with the term "reliable," an important concept in the task. When asked what this term meant, all responded with answers indicating that they understood the term (e.g., "It means that you can trust it;" "It means it will always be there for you;" or "It's like a friend that you can trust"). See also.<ref>{{cite journal |url=http://advance.uconn.edu/2006/061113/06111308.htm | title=Researchers find kids need better online academic skills |journal=UComm Advance |author=Beth Krane |publisher=[[University of Connecticut]] |date=November 13, 2006 |volume=25|issue=12 |quote=Don Leu, Chair in Literacy and Technology at UConn, "All 25 students fell for the Internet hoax....anyone can publish anything on the Internet, and today's students are not prepared to critically evaluate the information they find there." |accessdate=2008-01-11 }}</ref><ref>{{cite journal | url=http://www.inklingmagazine.com/articles/tentacled-tree-hugger-gets-legs-up-on-twelve-year-olds/ |date=March 14, 2007 |title = Tentacled Tree Hugger Disarms Seventh Graders |journal=Inkling |author=Matthew Bettelheim |quote=Of the 25 seventh-graders identified as their schools’ best online readers, 24 recommended this bogus website to another class that Leu had told them was also researching endangered species. |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070320203138/http://www.inklingmagazine.com/articles/tentacled-tree-hugger-gets-legs-up-on-twelve-year-olds/ |archive-date=2007-03-20 |access-date=13 May 2016|dead-url=yes}}</ref>
In the spring of 2017, Loos, Ivan & Leu (2018)<ref>Loos, E.F., Ivan, L., & Leu, D. (2018). Save The Pacific Northwest Tree Octopus”: a hoax revisited. Or: how vulnerable are school children to Fake News? ''Information and'' ''Learning Science, 119'' (9, 10), 514-528.
</ref> replicated the study in a Dutch school class of 27 children (13 girls and 14 boys, 11/12 years old) in the following way: The teacher and the school children were told by the first author of the study that the lesson that would follow would be an online reading comprehension exercise; the real purpose of the lesson was not revealed in advance. The children were asked by the scholar to visit the abovementioned website. They were given the following instructions: “Have a look at this website. Look at the pictures, click on the links if you wish. Do not hurry, you have time enough. And this is not a test. It will not be graded.” The website was automatically translated to Dutch, a facility offered by the chrome notebook they all used. Then, they were asked to answer the following questions: (1) This website presents an octopus living in trees. What country does this animal live in?, (2) According to the website, this particular octopus is an endangered species. For what reason?, (3) If Greenpeace were to ask you to save this octopus, would you support this and sign? YES, because … NO, because … (choose one), (4) Were there parts of the website you didn’t understand? If so, please explain., (5) Are there any other comments about this website you would like to make?" Hence, these school children thought the text was about their willingness to undertake action for an endangered animal. The pupils who answered ‘YES’ to question (3) were judged as perceiving the site as a reliable one. In this way, it was not necessary to explicitly ask about the reliability of the site, which would have risked priming them. The school children were debriefed after the session and they received a new media literacies training. ===Results=== The 2007 US study found that slightly more than half (27) of the 53 schoolchildren taking part in the study reported the website as being very reliable. Only 6 out of the 53 school children (11%) viewed the website as unreliable. Each of these 6 school children had just participated in a lesson that used this website to teach them to be suspicious of information online. In the 2017 Dutch study only 2 out of the in total 27 schoolchildren (7%) recognized that the website was a hoax. The setting of the task (school environment), the trust in their teacher and the scholar, and the emotional involvement (the topic was an animal in danger) might have made it more difficult for them to perceive the information on the website as fake. Several told the scholar they were shocked that they had considered the digital information on the website to be reliable, as they had received several new literacies training at school over the past year.

[[Deathrock]] | Length = 3:06 | Label = | Writer = D. Bolles, [[Dinah Cancer|D. Cancer]] | Producer = | Certification = | Last single = "[[Black Cross (song)|Black Cross]]"
(1981) | This single = "'''School's Out'''"
(1984) | Next single = | Misc = }} "'''Partytime'''" is a song by [[45 Grave]], released as the [[A-side and B-side|B-side]] to the "[[School's Out (song)|School's Out]]" single in 1984.http://www.discogs.com/45-Grave-Schools-Out/release/399224 The song was taken from their debut album, ''[[Sleep in Safety]]''. However, the single version, dubbed "Partytime (The Story of Sabine)", is shorter in length and notably heavier, with more smoothly flowing lyrics and a shorter introduction. This single version was included on the 1993 reissue of ''Sleep in Safety''. "Partytime" is probably 45 Grave's most well-known song, having been used as the theme song to the 1985 film ''[[The Return of the Living Dead]]'' and featured on the [[The Return of the Living Dead#Soundtrack|soundtrack]]. This "Zombie Version" was shorter and heavier than both previous versions of the song, and eschewed the story of the previous versions. Another version, featured on compilations ''[[Autopsy (45 Grave album)|Autopsy]]'', ''Debasement Tapes'' and ''A Devil's Possessions'', has a different vocal melody and is introduced with laughter and different lyrics. The A-side, "School's Out," a cover of the [[Alice Cooper]] song of the same name, was featured as a bonus track on the re-released version of ''[[Sleep in Safety]]''. This version differs little from Cooper's original, but makes use of [[Synthesizer|keyboards]]. ==Lyrics and interpretation== The song is about a 5-year-old girl who is brutally raped, abused and killed by her mother and friends, and the events that followed. As Dinah Cancer explained: "It's based on a story that I read in a true crime mag. The insanity and cruelty went on. So that 'Partytime' is about child abuse but it is written as a tribute to the little girl, Sabine. The song is about what her family did to her and how she didn't deserve it".[http://www.mysteryisland.net/dinahcancer Interview with Dinah Cancer] ==In popular culture== "Partytime" was notably used in the 1985 film ''The Return of the Living Dead'', and was later used during the ''[[Call of Duty: Black Ops]]'' "Call of the Dead" trailer. ==Track listing== ===Side A=== # "[[School's Out (song)|School's Out]]" – 3:33 ===Side B=== # "Partytime (The Story of Sabine)" - 3:06 ==Notes== {{Reflist|colwidth=30em}} ==External links== * {{MetroLyrics song|45-grave|partytime}} {{45 Grave}} [[Category:1984 songs]] [[Category:45 Grave songs]] [[Category:Songs written for films]] [[Category:Songs based on actual events]] [[Category:Songs about child abuse]] [[Category:Works about rape]]

{{redirect|Polar bear club|the New York-based band|Polar Bear Club}} {{See also|Winter swimming}} {{primary sources|date=December 2014}} {{Use mdy dates|date=December 2014}} [[File:Polar Bear Plunge in the water.jpg|thumb|right|Participants in the water during a polar bear plunge. Note the ice on the water indicates that the water is cold.]] A '''polar bear plunge''' is an event held during the winter where participants enter a body of water despite the low temperature. In the United States, polar bear plunges are usually held to raise money for a [[charitable organization]]. In Canada, polar bear swims are usually held on New Year's Day to celebrate the new year.
==Canada== In Canada, "Polar Bear Swims", "plunges" or "dips" are a New Year's Day tradition in numerous communities across the country.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cbc.ca/canada/story/2010/01/01/canada-polar-bear-dip-new-year.html |accessdate=December 31, 2010 |deadurl=yes |title=Polar bear dippers start 2010 with icy plunge|date=January 1, 2010 |publisher=CBC News|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100105033902/http://www.cbc.ca/canada/story/2010/01/01/canada-polar-bear-dip-new-year.html |archivedate=January 5, 2010 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref name="CBC2013">{{cite web|url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/canadian-polar-bear-dippers-brave-freezing-temperatures-1.1413252|title=Canadian polar bear dippers brave freezing temperatures|date=January 1, 2013|publisher=CBC News}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/toronto/polar-bear-dips-deep-freeze-doesn-t-dissuade-swimmers-1.2481075|title=Polar bear dips: deep freeze doesn't dissuade swimmers|date=January 1, 2014|publisher=CBC News}}</ref><ref>[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9Ly-TFRiPy4 Watch ''The Rick Mercer Report'' segment on Polar Bear Dipping in Canada]</ref> [[Vancouver]], BC's annual Polar Bear Swim Club has been active since 1920 and typically has 1,000 to 2,000 registered participants, with a record 2,128 plunging into English Bay in 2000. Registration is not enforced and the actual number of swimmers may be significantly higher. Estimates of the number of observers are typically up to 10,000.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://vancouver.ca/parks/events/polarbear/history.htm|title=Home - City of Vancouver|author=City of Vancouver|publisher=|accessdate=December 26, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://vancouver.ca/parks-recreation-culture/polar-bear-swim.aspx|title=Polar Bear Swim|first=City of|last=Vancouver|date=January 6, 2017|website=vancouver.ca|accessdate=December 29, 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://vancouver.ca/parks-recreation-culture/polar-bear-swim-statistics.aspx|title=Polar bear swim statistics|first=City of|last=Vancouver|date=December 6, 2012|website=vancouver.ca|accessdate=December 29, 2017}}</ref> Suburban White Rock, BC's was founded in 1958, and other suburbs including North Vancouver, Surrey, Delta and Langley also hold swims.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.peacearchnews.com/news/hundreds-take-plunge-at-white-rocks-polar-bear-swim/|title=Hundreds take plunge at White Rock's Polar Bear Swim - Peace Arch News|date=January 2, 2015|publisher=|accessdate=December 29, 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.peacearchnews.com/life/rotary-roundup-rotary-hosted-polar-bear-swim-always-popular/|title=ROTARY ROUNDUP: Rotary-hosted polar bear swim always popular - Peace Arch News|date=January 27, 2017|publisher=|accessdate=December 29, 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.peacearchnews.com/trending-now/heres-a-list-of-polar-bear-swims-in-the-lower-mainland/|title=Here's a list of polar bear swims in the Lower Mainland - Peace Arch News|date=December 29, 2016|publisher=|accessdate=December 29, 2017}}</ref>
Other locations include [[Bowen Island]], BC,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://bowen-island-bc.com/forum/read.php?1,1290016|title=Correct Link - New Years Day Swim Video 2014|website=bowen-island-bc.com|accessdate=December 29, 2017}}</ref> [[Edmonton]], AB,{{Citation needed|date=December 2014}} [[Calgary]], AB,{{Citation needed|date=December 2014}} [[Ottawa]], ON,{{Citation needed|date=December 2014}} [[Oakville, Ontario|Oakville]], ON,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.polarbeardip.ca/|title=Courage Polar Bear Dip|publisher=|accessdate=December 26, 2014}}</ref> [[Toronto]], ON,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.torontopolarbear.com/|title=Annual Toronto Polar Bear Dip - In support of Habitat for Humanity Greater Toronto Area|publisher=|accessdate=December 26, 2014}}</ref> [[perth, Ontario|Perth]], ON,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.perthpolarbearplunge.ca/|title=Perth Polar Bear Plunge - Official Home Page|publisher=|accessdate=December 26, 2014}}</ref> [[Clarington]], ON,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://claringtonpolarbearswim.com/|title=Clarington Polar Bear Swim|publisher=|accessdate=December 26, 2014}}</ref> [[Sarnia]], ON,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.theobserver.ca/2012/12/29/sarnia-lambton-residents-take-the-plunge-for-right-to-play|title='Freezin' for a reason'|work=Sarnia Observer|accessdate=December 26, 2014}}</ref> [[Montreal]], QC,{{Citation needed|date=December 2014}} [[North Hatley, Quebec|North Hatley]], QC,{{Citation needed|date=December 2014}} [[Halifax, Nova Scotia|Halifax]], NS,{{Citation needed|date=December 2014}} [[Prince Edward Island]],{{Citation needed|date=December 2014}}, Ness Lake north of Prince George, BC and [[St. John's, Newfoundland and Labrador|St. John's]], NL.{{Citation needed|date=December 2014}} In [[Yellowknife]], NWT, the "Freezin for a Reason" plunge is held in March after the spring thaw.{{Citation needed|date=December 2014}}
==Netherlands== [[File:Nieuwjaarsduik.jpg|thumb|right|320px|The Nieuwjaarsduik in Scheveningen (2010)]] Every New Year's Day around 10,000 people dive collectively into the icy cold sea water at [[Scheveningen]], a Dutch beach resort town, since 1960. In 89 locations on beaches and in lakes all over the country, each year around 30,000 people participate in this "Nieuwjaarsduik" (English: New Year's dive), with a record 36,000 participants on January 1, 2012. Since 1998, [[Unox]], a [[Unilever]] food brand often associated with winter, adopted the Nieuwjaarsduik and ever since it is tradition to wear Unox branded winter caps and gloves.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.unox.nl/nl/event/nieuwjaarsduik/info_url|title=UNOX NIEUWJAARSDUIK 2018|publisher=|accessdate=December 29, 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.telegraaf.nl/binnenland/11221271/__Nieuwjaarsduik_bijzonder_populair_dit_jaar__.html|title=Nieuwjaarsduik bijzonder populair dit jaar|work=telegraaf.nl}}</ref>
==New Zealand== Polar plunges (the local name) are held at various beaches in New Zealand, usually on the weekend closest to the shortest day in late June. Among other places, polar plunges are led at [[Papamoa Beach]] ([[Tauranga]]),<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nzherald.co.nz/bay-news/news/article.cfm?c_id=1503768&objectid=11893471|title=Papamoa Polar Plunge|first=Rebecca|last=Mauger|date=July 20, 2017|publisher=|accessdate=January 12, 2018|via=www.nzherald.co.nz}}</ref> [[Saint Clair Beach]] ([[Dunedin]]),<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nzherald.co.nz/|title=Hundreds take Polar Plunge in Dunedin|first=Shawn|last=McAvinue|date=June 16, 2013|publisher=|accessdate=January 12, 2018|via=www.nzherald.co.nz}}</ref> and [[Castlecliff]] ([[Wanganui]]).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nzherald.co.nz/wanganui-chronicle/news/article.cfm?c_id=1503426&objectid=11877592|title=Blimey that's cold! Will you take the polar plunge?|first=Anne-Marie McDonald Anne-Marie McDonald is a reporter for the Wanganui Chronicle anne-marie McDonald@wanganuichronicle co nz|last=LoveThisPaper|date=June 17, 2017|publisher=|accessdate=January 12, 2018|via=www.nzherald.co.nz}}</ref>
==United Kingdom== An annual "Loony Dook" takes place in South Queensferry, Scotland, on New Year's Day. Several thousand attend the event with over one thousand taking the plunge.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.theloonydook.co.uk|title=Default Parallels Plesk Panel Page|publisher=|accessdate=December 26, 2014}}</ref> Participants regularly dress up for the occasion and will usually parade through the local town acting like "loonies" proceeding the "dook". Aside from the regular enthusiasts, most are still inebriated from New Year's Eve celebrations and have more than likely lost a bet.
Another, smaller plunge occurs on Christmas Day at Blackroot Pool in [[Sutton Park]], Birmingham, England.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.birminghammail.co.uk/news/midlands-news/sutton-park-christmas-day-swim-8345005|title=Sutton Park Christmas Day swim: Watch brave Brummies plunge into Blackroot Pool|publisher=|accessdate=September 15, 2016}}</ref> Often, participants aim to raise money for charity.
In the British Overseas Territory of [[Gibraltar]], an annual swim is held on Boxing Day.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.visitgibraltar.gi/event/polar-bear-swim-2015/73|title=Visit Gibraltar - Previous Events|website=www.visitgibraltar.gi|accessdate=December 29, 2017}}</ref>
==United States== [[File:Two brave girls - Polar Bear Plunge 2009.jpg|thumb|right|Two women prepare to enter the water in Milwaukee]] Plunges are now held across the United States. Annual events are held in Seattle (since 1993), Evergreen, Colorado<ref>{{Cite web | title = Seattle Parks and Recreation - Polar Bear Plunge | work = seattle.gov | accessdate = December 26, 2014 | url = http://www.seattle.gov/parks/aquatics/polarbearplunge.htm }}</ref> New York's [[Coney Island Polar Bear Club]],<ref name="CBC2013"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.polarbearclub.org/|title=Coney Island Polar Bear Club|website=www.polarbearclub.org|accessdate=December 29, 2017}}</ref> Lake George, NY,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lakegeorgewintercarnival.com/|title=Lake George Winter Carnival|website=www.lakegeorgewintercarnival.com|accessdate=December 29, 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GIEfzTPxg-Q|title=Polar Bear Plunge Lake George 2013|first=|last=hairstylistdude|date=January 2, 2013|publisher=|accessdate=December 29, 2017|via=YouTube}}</ref> [[L Street Brownies|Boston (since 1904)]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.boston-discovery-guide.com/boston-event-calendar-january-2010.html|title=Boston Event Calendar January 2010|publisher=|accessdate=December 26, 2014}}</ref> Milwaukee's Bradford Beach (since 1916),<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jsonline.com/news/milwaukee/36906624.html|title=Jim Stingl - Polar plunging boasts long, chilly history in Milwaukee|publisher=|accessdate=December 26, 2014}}</ref> New Hampshire,<ref name="now.dartmouth.edu">{{Cite web |title=Students Take Icy Plunge in 19th Annual Polar Bear Swim {{!}} Dartmouth Now |work=now.dartmouth.edu |accessdate=December 26, 2014 |url=http://now.dartmouth.edu/2013/02/students-take-icy-plunge-in-19th-annual-polar-bear-swim/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141226212459/http://now.dartmouth.edu/2013/02/students-take-icy-plunge-in-19th-annual-polar-bear-swim/ |archive-date=December 26, 2014 |dead-url=yes |df=mdy-all }}</ref> and New Jersey.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.njpolarplunge.org/|title=Special Olympics New Jersey - Polar Bear Plunge|publisher=|accessdate=December 26, 2014}}</ref> Some, such as Minnesota's,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.plungemn.org/index.php?page=whatstheplunge|title=Polar Plunge Presented by Law Enforcement for Special Olympics Minnesota|publisher=|accessdate=December 26, 2014}}</ref> are held to raise proceeds for the [[Special Olympics]]. Geisel School of Medicine at Dartmouth College also organizes an annual "Polar Plunge for Health Equity" into Occom Pond.<ref name="now.dartmouth.edu"/>
The Polar Bear Plunge event in Maryland, the largest polar bear plunge in the United States, held annually at [[Sandy Point State Park]], raises funds for the Special Olympics.<ref name="Plungapalooza">{{cite news|title=Cold Enough For You?|last=Abrams|first=Amanda|date=February 3, 2009|work=Express|publisher=The Washington Post|pages=E7}}</ref> Sponsored by the [[Maryland State Police]], in 2007, Plungapalooza raised $2.2 million and had 7,400 participants.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://somd.convio.net/site/PageNavigator/MSP_Polar_Bear_Plunge.html|title=Special Olympics Maryland|website=somd.convio.net|accessdate=December 29, 2017}}</ref> In 2008, an estimated 12,000 people participated.<ref name="Maryland Polar Bear Plunge" />
Every Super Bowl Sunday, [[Long Beach, New York]] hosts one of the largest in the US. Since 1998 thousands of people have flocked to the beaches of Long Beach to jump into the ocean on Super Bowl Sunday. All proceeds are donated to the [[Make-A-Wish Foundation]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.soill.org/about-the-plunge/|title=Special Olympics Illinois|publisher=|accessdate=December 26, 2014}}</ref>
From February to March each year, Polar Plunges are held in numerous locations throughout the state of [[Illinois]]. Donations and proceeds raised for the [[Special Olympics]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.soill.org/polar-plunge/|title=Special Olympics Illinois - Polar Plunge|accessdate=August 14, 2018}}</ref>
== South Korea== [[File:Busan Polar Bear Swimming Contest.jpg|thumb|right|Busan Polar Bear Swimming Contest in Busan, South Korea]] An annual Polar Bear Swimming Contest takes place annually at the [[Haeundae Beach]] in [[Busan]], South Korea.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=20140103000710&mod=skb|title=Calendar|work=Korea Herald|date=2014-01-03 |language=en|access-date=2018-08-16}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://bear.busan.com/en|title=The 31th Polar Bear Swim Festival|website=bear.busan.com|language=en|access-date=2018-08-16}}</ref>
==Midsummer polar plunge (Antarctica)== A polar plunge is also held every midsummer in Antarctica – a rite of passage for scientists and visitors to New Zealand's [[Scott Base]]. It is held in late December.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.stuff.co.nz/national/8129131/Antarctic-plunge-like-Waiheke-in-winter|title=Antarctic plunge like 'Waiheke in winter'|website=Stuff|accessdate=January 12, 2018}}</ref>

{{Use Pakistani English|date=July 2016}} {{Use dmy dates|date=March 2016}} {{Infobox person | name = Qandeel Baloch | image = Qandeel Baloch.jpg | caption = Qandeel Baloch in 2016 during [[BBC Urdu]] interview. | birth_name = Fouzia Azeem <!-- Her name on passport is Fouzia not Faizia --> | birth_date = {{birth date|1990|3|1|df=y}} <!--Her date of birth on passport is 1990 not 1985 --> | birth_place = [[Dera Ghazi Khan]], [[Punjab, Pakistan|Punjab]], [[Pakistan]] <!-- Place of Birth is [[Dera Ghazi Khan]] according to her passport --> | death_date = {{death date and age|2016|7|15|1990|3|1|df=y}} <!--Don't change the date see section death, for death time--> | death_place = [[Multan]], [[Punjab, Pakistan]] | death_cause = Homicide by [[asphyxia]] | resting_place = | residence = | nationality = [[Pakistani people|Pakistani]] | other_names = Qandeel Marha | occupation = Model, actress, activist, Social media celebrity | years_active = 2013{{ndash}}2016 | spouse = Aashiq Hussain (m. 2008) | children = 1 | website = }} '''Fouzia Azeem''' ({{lang-ur|{{Nastaliq|فوزیہ عظیم}}}}; 1 March 1990 – 15 July 2016), better known by the name '''Qandeel Baloch''' ({{lang-ur|{{Nastaliq|قندیل بلوچ}}}}), was a [[Pakistanis|Pakistani]] model, actress, and [[social media celebrity]]. Baloch rose to prominence due to her [[Video blog|videos]] on [[social network]]s discussing her daily routine and various controversial issues.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.samaa.tv/social-buzz/2015/09/self-proclaimed-drama-queen-qandeel-baloch |title=Self proclaimed drama queen: Qandeel Baloch |last=Raza |first=Sarah |date=9 September 2015 |work=Samaa TV |last2=Rehman |first2=Ayesha}}</ref>
Baloch first received recognition from the media in 2013, when she auditioned for ''[[Pakistan Idol]]''; her audition went viral and she became an [[Internet celebrity]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Hilarious audition of Qandeel Baloch In Pakistan Idol|url=http://www.abplive.in/lifestyle/video-hilarious-audition-of-qandeel-baloch-in-pakistan-idol-310152|publisher=''[[ABP Live]]''|date=23 March 2016|accessdate=16 July 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Desperate for instant fame, Pakistan model Qandeel Baloch, who had recently made headlines with her antics to gain popularity, now has come with another way of grabbing the limelight.|url=http://www.siasat.com/news/watch-hilarious-audition-qandeel-baloch-pakistan-idol-936771/|publisher=''Siasat.pk''|date=24 March 2016|accessdate=16 July 2016}}</ref> She was one of the top 10 most searched for persons on the internet in Pakistan and both celebrated and criticised for the content of her videos and posts.<ref name="auto">{{Cite web|url=http://indianexpress.com/article/trending/trending-globally/qandeel-baloch-murder-this-video-gives-an-insight-into-the-internet-sensations-life-2917727/|title=Qandeel Baloch murder: This video gives an insight into the Pakistani model’s life|date=2016-07-16|access-date=2016-07-17}}</ref>
During the evening of 15 July 2016, Baloch was asphyxiated while she was asleep in the house where her parents live in [[Multan]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Qandeel Baloch murdered by brother in Multan: police|url=http://www.dawn.com/news/1271213/|first=Imran|last=Gabol|publisher=''[[Dawn News]]''|date=16 July 2016|accessdate=16 July 2016}}</ref> Her brother Waseem Azeem confessed to the murder saying she was "bringing disrepute" to the "family's honour".<ref name="Qandeelbrotherfoundguilty">{{cite web|title=Qandeel Baloch’s brother arrested, says he killed her for ‘honour’|url=http://www.pakistantoday.com.pk/2016/07/17/national/qandeel-balochs-brother-arrested-says-he-killed-her-for-honour/|publisher=''Pakistan Today''|date=17 July 2016|accessdate=17 July 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Pakistani Instagram star Qandeel Baloch 'strangled in honour killing by her brother for posting raunchy clips and photos'|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3693320/Pakistani-social-media-celebrity-Qandeel-Baloch-strangled-brother-posting-raunchy-clips-photos.html|first=Ekin|last=Karasin|publisher=''[[Daily Mail (UK)]]''|date=16 July 2016| accessdate = 17 July 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Pakistani Model Qandeel Baloch Strangled by Brother in Apparent ‘Honor Killing’|url=http://time.com/4409410/pakistani-model-qandeel-baloch-strangled-by-brother-in-apparent-honor-killing/|first=Katie|last=Reilly|publisher=''[[Time (magazine)]]''|date=16 July 2016|accessdate=17 July 2016}}</ref>
== Early life == Baloch was born on 1 March 1990 in [[Dera Ghazi Khan]],<ref name="dailypakistan"/> [[Punjab, Pakistan|Punjab]]. She hailed from [[Shah Sadar Din]].<ref name="dailypakistan">{{Cite news |url=http://en.dailypakistan.com.pk/viral/the-unthinkable-story-qandeel-baloch-who-was-a-bus-hostess-before-becoming-controversy-queen/ |title=Qandeel’s Cinderella story: How a bus hostess from Shadun Lund became controversy queen in Karachi |last=Sindhu |first=Haider Ali |date=23 June 2016 |website=en.dailypakistan.com.pk}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.cnn.com/2016/07/24/world/qandeel-baloch-death-father-azeem/index.html|title=Father of slain social media star: 'It is my desire to take revenge'|last=CNN|first=Chieu Luu, CNN and Shazia Bhatti, for|work=CNN|access-date=2017-11-17}}</ref> and an underprivileged family and had six brothers and two sisters. Her first job was as a bus hostess.<ref name=":3" />
==Career== Baloch's fame was based on her social media posts – pictures, videos and comments. These were considered bold and outrageous by the largely conservative Pakistani community. Her most popular videos were those of her with her catchphrase "How em luking?"(How am I looking?) and those of her saying "Maire sar mai pain ho raha hai" (I'm getting a headache) in a funny and catchy tone. Her catchphrases became viral and were used by the Pakistani youth in enjoyment. They were also featured of dubbing social media site [[dubsmash]] and became widely popular among Indian and Pakistani youth alike.<ref name="auto"/> Some international news media compared her to [[Kim Kardashian]];<ref>{{cite news|title=To post or not to post|url=http://www.nationmultimedia.com/life/To-post-or-not-to-post-30280316.html|work=The Nation|date=29 February 2016|accessdate=16 July 2016}}</ref> however, local commentators stated that she was more significant than Kardashian, as Baloch "went against the norms of society" and lived life on her own terms.<ref name=":2">{{Cite web|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/2016/07/pakistan-anger-honour-killing-qandeel-baloch-160716140502239.html|title=Pakistan: Anger after honour killing of Qandeel Baloch|website=www.aljazeera.com|access-date=2016-07-17}}</ref> She started to appear on Pakistani talk shows regularly by 2014, either to perform songs or to discuss her rising social media popularity. During her life she served as digital manager at Neptuner Web Solutions<ref name="newton">{{cite web|last1=Web Solutions|first1=Neptuner|title=digital marketing manager|url=http://www.neptuner.org/|website=Neptuner web Solutions}}</ref> in 2016
In June 2016, Baloch met senior cleric [[Mufti]] [[Mufti Abdul Qawi|Abdul Qawi]] in a hotel room to learn more about her faith; the interaction between them brought about mayhem on social media platforms as their photos went viral online.<ref>{{cite news|title=When Qandeel Baloch met Mufti Qavi: A guideline on how NOT to learn Islam|url=http://tribune.com.pk/story/1127984/qandeel-baloch-met-mufti-qavi-guideline-not-learn-islam/|publisher=[[The Express Tribune]]|accessdate=22 June 2016}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |url=http://en.dailypakistan.com.pk/lifestyle/real-story-of-mufti-qavis-breaks-fast-with-qandeel-balcoh/ |title=What really happened when Mufti Abdul Qavi broke his fast with Qandeel Baloch in a hotel? |last=Hussain |first=Fayyaz |access-date=22 June 2016 |agency=[[Daily Pakistan]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Qandeel Baloch claims Mufti Qavi ‘hopelessly in love’ with her!|url=http://www.pakistantoday.com.pk/2016/06/20/news/mufti-qavi-breaks-fast-with-qandeel-baloch/|accessdate=22 June 2016|agency=[[Pakistan Today]]}}</ref> She also wore a hat with the Mufti's signature.<ref>{{cite news|title=Qandeel Baloch stirs storm with selfies|url=http://www.thenews.com.pk/latest/129556-Qandeel-Baloch-stirs-storm-with-selfies|accessdate=22 June 2016|agency=[[The News International|THE NEWS INTERNATIONAL]]}}</ref> The meeting led to the Mufti being suspended from his position on one of Pakistan's religious committees, and to Baloch being a regular on popular Pakistani current affairs and news programmes. She appeared on various popular Pakistani TV shows with senior anchors such as [[Mubashir Lucman]]. She would mostly be on talk shows debating with religious scholars on her western and controversial acts and lifestyle.<ref name=":1">{{Cite news|url=http://www.cnn.com/2016/07/16/asia/pakistan-qandeel-baloch-murder/index.html|title=Pakistan social media star killed by brother|publisher=CNN|first=Sophia |last=Saifi|website=CNN|access-date=2016-07-17}}</ref>
A previous stunt which went viral on social media was her promise to strip dance for her followers and to dedicate her dance to cricketer [[Shahid Afridi]] if Pakistan won the [[Twenty20]] match against India on 19 March 2016. She released a teaser on social media, which went viral, but Pakistan lost the match.<ref>{{cite news|title=Qandeel Baloch: Pak model to strip if team win WT20 match against India|url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/world-t20/qandeel-baloch-pak-model-to-strip-if-team-win-wt20-match-against-india/story-n2YzcisDpdu7CMCrvQAuGI.html|work=Hindustan Times|date=18 March 2016}}</ref> Some Indian media compared her with [[Poonam Pandey]] at this point due to her controversial personality.<ref>{{cite news|title=Someone seems to be going the Poonam Pandey way this #WT20 season. Howzat?|url=http://www.ibnlive.com/news/buzz/someone-seems-to-be-going-the-poonam-pandey-way-this-wt20-season-howzat-1216958.html|first= Tanushree |last=Pandey|work=IBN Live|date=16 March 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Pakistan Got its own Poonam Pandey! Here's What She'll Do If Pak Wins WC '16|url=http://daily.bhaskar.com/news-hf/TOP-world-cup-t20-pakistan-vs-india-model-offers-to-strip-for-shahid-afridi-5276572-PHO.html|work=Dailybhaskar.com|date=17 March 2016}}</ref>
As her media presence grew, Baloch began to use her position to comment on [[Women in Pakistan|women's position in Pakistani society]]. The week before she died, she released a music video entitled ''Ban,'' which mocked the restrictions placed on women in the country.<ref name=":1" /> In an interview with controversial anchor [[Mubashir Luqman]], Baloch named [[Sunny Leone]], [[Rakhi Sawant]] and [[Poonam Pandey]] as her inspirations.<ref>{{Citation|last=APDP – All Pakistani Dramas Page|title=Khara Sach With Mubashir Luqman 25 March 2016 – Qandeel Baloch Exclusive Interview|date=2016-03-25|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=InKBCMLwsQk|accessdate=2016-03-26}}</ref> She also said that many organizations, people and media groups were calling her to feature in their shows to increase their own [[Target rating point|ratings]].
=== Security concerns === Following the June 2016 meeting with Qawi, Baloch kept a press conference and reported that she received death threats both from him and from others, and demanded police protection from the state.<ref name=":1" /><ref>{{Cite news |url=http://tribune.com.pk/story/1129476/receiving-life-threatening-calls-mufti-qawi-claims-qandeel-baloch/ |title=Receiving life-threatening calls from Mufti Qawi, claims Qandeel Baloch |work=[[The Express Tribune]] |access-date=16 July 2016}}</ref>
At around the same time, Baloch's ex-husband described in the media their brief marriage, revealing intimate details of their relationship. Baloch claimed her husband had been abusive, and cried publicly about the pain of the marriage.<ref name=":2"/> Around 14 July 2016, Baloch spoke by phone to a reporter from the ''[[Express Tribune]]'' paper and stated that she feared for her life.<ref name=":1" /> She told the reporter that she had sought protection from the police but on receiving no response, had decided to move abroad with her parents after the [[Eid al-Fitr]] holiday as she felt unsafe in Pakistan.<ref name=":3">{{Cite news |url=http://tribune.com.pk/story/1142996/qandeel-baloch-shot-dead-multan/ |title=Qandeel Baloch strangled to death by brother in suspected honour killing |date=2016-07-16 |work=[[The Express Tribune]] |access-date=2016-07-17 |language=en-US}}</ref>
== Personal life == Baloch married Aashiq Hussain in 2008, aged 17, and had one son with him.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://tribune.com.pk/story/1141469/plot-thickens-qandeel-baloch-married-son/ |title=Plot thickens: Qandeel Baloch was once married and has a son |work=[[The Express Tribune]] |access-date=16 July 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Qandeel Baloch's ex-husband comes forward with startling claims|url=http://tribune.com.pk/story/1141118/qandeel-balochs-ex-husband-comes-forward-startling-claims/|accessdate=16 July 2016|agency=[[The Express Tribune]]}}</ref> Baloch left her husband a year later, saying he was abusive.<ref name=":3" /><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://channel24.pk/pakistan/2016/07/13/qandeels-baloch-is-mother-of-a-7-yr-old-son/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160715160037/http://channel24.pk/pakistan/2016/07/13/qandeels-baloch-is-mother-of-a-7-yr-old-son/|dead-url=yes|archive-date=2016-07-15|title=Secret marriage of Qandeel Baloch; Mother of seven years old son|last=Mohsin|first=Mahboob|date=2016-07-13|website=24 News HD|language=en-US|access-date=2016-07-13}}</ref> There are reports Baloch was separated from a second marriage.<ref name="firstpost-death">{{cite news|title=Pakistani model Qandeel Baloch murdered in suspected 'honour killing'|url=http://www.firstpost.com/world/pakistani-model-qandeel-baloch-shot-dead-in-suspected-honour-killing-2896966.html|accessdate=16 July 2016|publisher=FirstPost|date=16 July 2016}}</ref>
== Death == On 15 July 2016, Qandeel Baloch was drugged and then asphyxiated by her brother M. Waseem while she was asleep at her parents' home in [[Multan]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.cnn.com/2016/07/24/world/qandeel-baloch-death-father-azeem/index.html|title=Father of slain social media star: 'It is my desire to take revenge'|last=CNN|first=Chieu Luu, CNN and Shazia Bhatti, for|work=CNN|access-date=2017-11-17}}</ref><ref name=":3" /><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/2016-07-17/brother-of-murdered-pakistan-social-media-star-arrested/7636446|title='I have no regrets': Brother of slain Pakistani social media star arrested|date=2016-07-17|website=ABC News|language=en-AU|access-date=2016-07-20}}</ref> Her death was reported by her father Azeem.<ref name=":3" /><ref name="Gabol 2016">{{cite web | last=Gabol | first=Imran | title=Qandeel Baloch killed by brother in Multan: police | website=DAWN.COM | date=2016-07-16 | url=http://www.dawn.com/news/1271213 | accessdate=2016-07-16}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Qandeel Baloch Killed by brother in Multan|url=http://whrill.com/qandeel-baloch-killed-by-brother-in-multan/|website=whrill.com|accessdate=16 July 2016}}</ref> It was first reported as a shooting, but an autopsy report confirmed that Baloch was murdered by asphyxiation while she was asleep,<ref>{{cite news|title=Qandeel’s dead body shows no marks of torture: autopsy report|url=http://www.pakistantoday.com.pk/2016/07/16/national/qandeels-dead-body-shows-no-marks-of-torture-autopsy-report/|accessdate=16 July 2016|agency=''[[Pakistan Today]]''}}</ref> on the night of 15–16 July, around 11:15 p.m. to 11:30 p.m. By the time her body was found she had already been dead for between fifteen and thirty-six hours.<ref>{{cite news|title=Qandeel Baloch’s autopsy reveals new facts|url=http://en.dailypakistan.com.pk/pakistan/qandeel-balochs-autopsy-reveals-new-facts/|first=Hamza|last=Rao|accessdate=16 July 2016|agency=''[[Daily Pakistan]]''}}</ref> Marks on Baloch's body revealed that her mouth and nose were pinned shut to asphyxiate her.<ref name=":2"/><ref>{{cite news|title=Breathing blockage caused Qandeel’s death: autopsy|url=http://www.samaa.tv/pakistan/2016/07/breathing-blockage-caused-qandeels-death-autopsy/|accessdate=16 July 2016|agency=''[[SAMAA TV]]''}}</ref> Police said that they would investigate all sides of the murder including [[honour killing]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Qandeel Baloch murdered in Multan for 'honour'|url=http://dunyanews.tv/en/Pakistan/345263-Qandeel-Baloch-murdered-in-Multan-for-honour|accessdate=16 July 2016|agency=''[[Dunya News]]''}}</ref>
A [[First Information Report]] against her brother Waseem and another brother Aslam Shaheen, who allegedly persuaded Waseem to kill their sister, was issued.<ref>{{cite news|title=FIR registered against brother of Qandeel Baloch|url=http://www.pakistantoday.com.pk/2016/07/16/national/fir-registered-against-brother-of-qandeel-baloch/|accessdate=16 July 2016|agency=''[[Pakistan Today]]''}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Qandeel's father nominates his two sons in daughter's murder, lodges FIR|url=http://www.dawn.com/news/1271223|first=Tassur|last=Subhani|agency=''[[Dawn News]]''|accessdate=16 July 2016|date=17 July 2016}}</ref> Baloch's father Azeem stated in the FIR that his sons Aslam Shaheen and Waseem were responsible for their sister’s death and had killed her for her money. Her father told the press "my daughter was brave and I will not forget or forgive her brutal murder."<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.pakistantoday.com.pk/2016/07/17/national/qandeel-balochs-brother-arrested-says-he-killed-her-for-honour/ |title=Qandeel Baloch's brother arrested says he killed her for honour |date=16 July 2016 |work=Pakistan Today |access-date=17 July 2016}}</ref>
Waseem was arrested on the evening of 16 July. He confessed to murdering his sister, saying "she [Qandeel Baloch] was bringing disrepute to our family's honour and I could not tolerate it any further. I killed her around 11:30 p.m. on Friday night when everyone else had gone to bed. My brother is not involved in the murder."<ref name="Qandeelbrotherfoundguilty"/>
===Murder case=== The state was named as [[complainant]] in her murder case, making it impossible for the victim's family to pardon the perpetrator <ref>{{Cite news|url=http://dailytimes.com.pk/pakistan/18-Jul-16/state-becomes-complainant-in-qandeels-murder-case|title=State becomes complainant in Qandeel’s murder case|date=2016-07-18|publisher=Daily Times, Pakistan}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/pakistan/Pakistan-bars-family-from-forgiving-son-for-Qandeel-Balochs-killing/articleshow/53281179.cms|title=Pakistan bars family from 'forgiving' son for Qandeel Baloch's killing|date=2016-07-18|work=[[Times of India]]|access-date=2016-07-19}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2016/jul/18/pakistan-social-media-star-qandeel-baloch-brother-killer-blood-money-law|title=Police stop murdered Pakistani star's brother from using blood money law|last=Boone|first=Jon|date=2016-07-18|newspaper=[[The Guardian]]|accessdate=2016-07-19}}</ref> (see [[Honour killing in Pakistan#1990 Qisas and Diyat Ordinance|the Pakistani ''diyaa'' law]]). An Islamic cleric, [[Mufti Abdul Qavi]]'s has been mentioned in the case's [[First Information Report]] (FIR) by her father.<ref>{{cite web|title=Mufti Abuld Qavi booked for Qandeel Baloch Murder Case|url=http://channel24.pk/breaking-news/2016/08/12/mufti-abdul-qavi-booked-qadeel-balochs-murder-case/|publisher=Channel24|accessdate=August 22, 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Mufti Abdul Qaci nominated for Qandeel Baloch Murder Case |url=http://www.bbc.com/urdu/pakistan/2016/08/160812_mufti_qavi_nominated_in_qandeel_case_sr?post_id=10205943318114637_10208841312322681#_=_|publisher=[[BBC]]|accessdate=August 22, 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Mufti Abuld Qavi booked for Qandeel Baloch Murder as Abettor|url= http://abbtakk.tv/en/qandeel-baloch-murder-mufti-abdul-qavi-nominated-as-abettor/|publisher=[[Abb Takk News]]|accessdate=August 22, 2016}}</ref> The cleric was previously involved<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://images.dawn.com/news/1175672|title=The story behind the Qandeel selfie that got Mufti Qavi suspended|last=|first=|date=|work=|access-date=}}</ref> and already being investigated by the Multan police at the time of murder.<ref>{{cite web|title=Mufti Qavi gets investigated in Qandeel Baloch Murder|url=https://www.geo.tv/latest/109637-Mufti-Qavi-instigated-murder-of-Qandeel-Baloch-mother|publisher=[[Geo News]]|accessdate=August 22, 2016}}</ref>
===Reactions=== {{See also|Honor killing in Pakistan}} Baloch's murder was widely condemned by media celebrities and people around the globe,<ref>{{cite news|title=Pakistan: Angehr after honour killing of Qandeel Baloch|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/2016/07/pakistan-anger-honour-killing-qandeel-baloch-160716140502239.html|first=Aliya|last=Chughtai| work=[[Aljazeera]]|accessdate=16 July 2016|date=17 July 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Notable personalities condemn Qandeel's 'honour killing'|url=http://dunyanews.tv/en/Pakistan/345274-Notable-personalities-condemn-Qandeels-honour-ki|publisher=''[[Dunya News]]''|accessdate=16 July 2016|date=17 July 2016}}</ref> while some in Pakistan were more inclined to support her murder.<ref>{{cite news|title=Qandeel Baloch's death takes Twitter by storm, Pakistan sees mixed reactions|url=http://www.business-standard.com/article/international/qandeel-baloch-s-death-takes-twitter-by-storm-pakistan-sees-mixed-reactions-116071600415_1.html| agency=''Business Standard''|accessdate=16 July 2016|date=17 July 2016}}</ref> Several personalities, including [[Madonna (entertainer)|Madonna]], [[Khloé Kardashian]], [[Miley Cyrus]], [[Jamie Lee Curtis]], Faryal Fatima, [[Rakhi Sawant]], [[Imran Khan]], [[Bilawal Bhutto Zardari]], [[Sharmila Farooqi]], [[Abdul Razaque]], [[Reham Khan]], [[Sanam Baloch]], [[Osman Khalid Butt]], [[Meesha Shafi]], Sabz Khan; UK Radio broadcaster on Allfm.org and Published author on Pakistani issues, [[Nadia Hussain]], [[Ali Zafar]],<ref>{{cite news|title=Pakistan reacts to Qandeel Baloch's shocking murder|url=http://images.dawn.com/news/1175823| agency=''Dawn News''|accessdate=16 July 2016|date=17 July 2016}}</ref> along with many others condemned the incident,<ref>{{cite news|title=Honor Killing of Qandeel Baloch condemned by famous personalities|url=http://aaj.tv/2016/07/honor-killing-of-qandeel-baloch-condemned-by-famous-personalities/|first=Rida|last=Lodhi|agency=''[[Aaj TV]]''|accessdate=16 July 2016|date=17 July 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Qandeel Baloch killed: Richa Chadha, Mishi Khan, Sabeena Khan (Published UK Author on Pakistani issues, Sharmeen Obaid-Chinoy and others mourn|url=http://www.ibtimes.co.in/qandeel-baloch-killed-richa-chadha-mishi-khan-sharmeen-obaid-chinoy-others-mourn-pakistani-686881#ixzz4EbtMGOLf|first=Rida|last=Lodhi|work=[[IB Times]]|publisher = ''gossip.pk''|accessdate=16 July 2016|date=17 July 2016}}</ref> including filmmaker and activist [[Sharmeen Obaid-Chinoy]] who said, "I really feel that no woman is safe in this country, until we start making examples of people, until we start sending men who kill women to jail, unless we literally say there will be no more killing and those who dare will spend the rest of their lives behind bars."<ref name= "BBC July 2016" >{{cite news|title=Qandeel Baloch: Pakistan social media celebrity 'killed by brother'|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-36814258|agency=''[[BBC]]''|accessdate=16 July 2016|date=17 July 2016}}</ref> She further said, "There is not a single day where you don't pick up a paper and see a woman hasn't been killed... this is an epidemic."<ref>{{cite news|title=Pakistan social media star Baloch killed 'by brother'|url=https://www.afp.com/en/news/23/pakistan-social-media-star-baloch-killed-brother|agency=''[[Agence France-Presse]]''|accessdate=16 July 2016|date=17 July 2016}}{{dead link|date=November 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref>
British Prime Minister [[Theresa May]] also condemned the murder saying "there is absolutely no honour in so-called honour killings and they should be referred to as acts of terror."<ref>{{cite news|title=Theresa May says there is 'no honour' in so-called honour killings|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/07/20/theresa-may-says-there-is-no-honour-in-so-called-honour-killings/|first=Laura |last=Hughes|publisher=''[[The Daily Telegraph|The Telegraph]]''|accessdate=18 July 2016|date=19 July 2016}}</ref> May also said it was 'criminal' for women to be murdered by their male relatives on the grounds of defending family 'honour'.<ref>{{cite news|title=British Prime Minister also speaks up about Qandeel Baloch’s murder|url=http://en.dailypakistan.com.pk/pakistan/british-prime-minister-also-speaks-up-about-qandeel-balochs-murder/|first=Hamza|last=Rao|work=[[Sky News]]|publisher=''[[Daily Pakistan]]''|accessdate=18 July 2016|date=19 July 2016}}</ref> The daughter of the Pakistani ex-Prime Minister [[Maryam Nawaz]] announced that the government had finalized the draft law against honour killings in the light of negotiations and the final draft will be presented to a committee of joint session of parliament on July 21 for consideration and approval.”<ref>{{cite news|title=Pakistan to pass law against honor killings in weeks: Maryam Nawaz|url=http://www.samaa.tv/pakistan/2016/07/pakistan-to-pass-law-against-honor-killings-in-weeks-maryam-nawaz/|publisher=''[[Sama TV]]''|accessdate=18 July 2016|date=19 July 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Pakistan to pass law against honor killings in weeks: PM's daughter|url=http://ca.reuters.com/article/topNews/idCAKCN1001HQ?pageNumber=2&virtualBrandChannel=0 |first=Mehreen |last=Zahra-Malik|publisher=''[[Reuters]]''|accessdate=18 July 2016|date=19 July 2016}}</ref>
Vigils for Baloch were held in [[Lahore]] and [[Karachi]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://tribune.com.pk/story/1143213/taken-away-vigil-held-qandeel-baloch/|title=Taken away: Vigil held for Qandeel Baloch|publisher=''The Express Tribune''|date=|accessdate=19 July 2016}}</ref> On November 2, 2017, the father of Qandeel Baloch submitted an application to police alleging that his life was in danger from those who planned his daughter's murder.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://dnd.com.pk/life-of-father-of-qandeel-baloch-in-danger/135054|title=Life of father of Qandeel Baloch in danger|date=2017-11-02|work=Dispatch News Desk|access-date=2018-09-12|language=en-US}}</ref>
==In popular culture== Baloch's death has drawn mixed reactions from different sections of society in Pakistan. Some called her death an honour killing and some think that the motive was money. An episode in the [[A-Plus Entertainment]] series ''Yeh Junoon'' was partially based on her life. The series starred [[Zhalay Sarhadi]] and [[Shamoon Abbasi]] in lead roles. [[Sharmeen Obaid-Chinoy]]'s untitled documentary film on her life is under production, that will be released in 2017.
On July 27. 2017, [[Urdu1]] started to air a 28-episode biopic television drama titled ''[[Baaghi (TV series)|Baaghi]]'' (meaning "Rebel" in Urdu) based on Qandeel's life, where [[Saba Qamar]] plays her character. The first episode amassed more than 1,200,000 views on YouTube. <ref>https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gOiiNhOD17o</ref>
In 2016, [[Dawn (newspaper)|Dawn]] reported that Baloch biography page on Wikipedia was the fourth most read amongst Pakistani personalities in 2016.<ref>{{cite news|title=Which Pakistanis dominated Wikipedia searches in 2016?|url=http://www.dawn.com/news/1304978/|accessdate=1 January 2017|publisher=Dawn|date=31 December 2016}}</ref>
In March 2017, The British-Pakistani/Indian-American hip hop group [[Swet Shop Boys]] dedicated the track ''Aaja'' from their latest album in the memory of Qandeel Baloch. Recorded samples of her voice from her social media content is also used towards the end of the track.<ref>{{cite video|title=Swet Shop Boys - Aaja ft. Ali Sethi (Official Music Video)|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=V4sKUUdxEmg|accessdate=31 August 2017|publisher=Youtube|date=2 March 2017}}</ref>
The musical band Bumbu Sauce also released a song on Qandeel Baloch entitled "Vuzzeerrayazam", which gives Qandeel the titles of ‘Prime Minister’ and ‘Qoum ki beti'.
On June 2017, a documentary film ''Undercover Asia S4: In The Name Of Honour'' premiered on [[Channel NewsAsia]]. Produced by MAKE Productions, it tells how Baloch's bold and sexy videos challenged convention and shocked a nation which later led to fatal consequences.<ref>{{cite web|title=Undercover Asia S4: In The Name Of Honour|url=http://www.channelnewsasia.com/news/catch-up-tv/undercover-asia-s4/in-the-name-of-honour-8957890|website=[[Channel NewsAsia]]|accessdate=15 November 2017|date=15 June 2017}}</ref>

{{Infobox music festival | name =Rendez-vous Houston | image =File:Rendezvous houston.jpg | caption =Houston skyline during Rendez-vous Houston concert | location =[[Houston, Texas|Houston]] | years_active = | founders =[[Jean Michel Jarre]] | dates =April 5, 1986 | genre = [[Rock music]] | attendance = | capacity = | website = }} '''''Rendez-vous Houston: A City in Concert''''' was a live performance by musician [[Jean Michel Jarre]] amidst the skyscrapers of [[Downtown Houston|downtown]] [[Houston, Texas|Houston]] on the evening of April 5, 1986, coinciding with the release of the ''[[Rendez-Vous (Jean Michel Jarre album)|Rendez-Vous]]'' album.<ref>{{cite magazine | date = April 19, 1986 | title = Rendezvous in Houston - A City in Concert | volume = 98 | issue = 16 | page = 82 | magazine = Billboard | publisher = Nielsen Business Media, Inc | issn = 0006-2510 | url = https://books.google.ru/books?id=HSUEAAAAMBAJ&pg=PT57#v=onepage&q&f=false }}</ref> For a period of time, it held a place in the ''[[Guinness Book of Records]]'' as the largest outdoor "rock concert" in history, with figures varying from 1 to 1.5 million in attendance. Rendez-vous Houston is remembered for being the concert which celebrated the astronauts of the [[Space Shuttle Challenger disaster|Space Shuttle ''Challenger'' disaster]], which had happened only two and a half months earlier. One of Jarre's friends, astronaut [[Ronald McNair|Ron McNair]], had been killed in the disaster.<ref>{{Cite AV media notes | title = Rendez-Vous | year = 1986 | first = Jean Michel | last = Jarre | authorlink = Jean Michel Jarre | type = liner notes | publisher = [[Disques Dreyfus]] }}</ref> He was supposed to play the [[saxophone]] from space during the track "Last Rendez-Vous"; his substitute for the concert was Houston native [[Kirk Whalum]].
==Planning and problems of the concert== In 1985, Jarre was contacted by the musical director of the [[Houston Grand Opera]] with the proposal for him related to the celebrations of Texas' 150th birthday in 1986, 150th birthday of the city of Houston and [[NASA]]'s 25th birthday. Because of NASA's involvement, Jarre got the chance to keep in contact with a friend of his, astronaut captain [[Bruce McCandless II]] who later introduced Jarre to a flight companion of his, astronaut and jazz musician [[Ronald McNair|Ron McNair]]. Together they had the idea that for the celebrations, Jarre would create a piece of music that could be performed by McNair on his saxophone. The idea was that McNair, on his next trip into space in the ''Challenger'' Space Shuttle, would perform (and record onto video) the new piece of music, which would then be projected (through video playback) onto a giant screen that was to be constructed on the front of one of the buildings.
<!-- Commented out because image was deleted: [[Image:Houston28.jpg|150ppx|left|thumb|Jean-Michel Jarre preparing the concert]] --> On January 28, 1986, McNair telephoned Jarre for the last time. "...Everything's ready. See you in a week's time. Watch me on TV for the takeoff!" On that same day, an appalled world witnessed a historic tragedy - the ''Challenger'' Space Shuttle disintegrated in mid-air while on its ascent into space. Distraught by what happened, Jarre almost decided to cancel the concert. However, astronauts from NASA (including Bruce McCandless) telephoned Jarre. They asked Jarre not to cancel, as now the concert ''must'' go ahead, and be held in tribute to pay respect to the astronauts who had lost their lives in the disaster.
The run-up to the concert itself still did not go smoothly. Rain poured down on Houston a couple of days before the concert, destroying much of the equipment on stage (which was repaired by the day of the concert), breaking wires and ruining instruments. Furthermore, there had been a very strong wind blowing all week, which ended up splitting open the giant projection screen (which was made from several small canvas panels) and causing it to come crashing down.
The local police turned up during the middle of a rehearsal demanding immediate payment of a fine; the residents who lived nearby were complaining of excessive noise and were exhausted from their sleepless nights. Also, [[FBI]] officers threatened to put a stop to the whole proceedings because they were being deprived of electricity. 30 large lamps had been installed on top of FBI headquarters, and they were causing problems with their surveillance of [[Muammar al-Gaddafi|Colonel Gaddafi]], who was visiting the city at that time.
There was still one more slight problem before the concert started. The chief of the [[Houston Fire Department]], Robert Clayton, had told Francis Dreyfus, Jarre's manager, that the show must be cancelled. This was due to a change of the wind direction; the Chief was concerned that the crowd would be showered with firework debris. After some back-and-forth argument with Dreyfus, Clayton agreed that the concert could proceed on a 'see how it goes' term.
During the concert (specifically, during the performance of [[Equinoxe]] Part 5), the amount of fireworks being used and the direction of the wind did indeed cause debris to rain down on the audience, covering them in ash. Clayton frantically began to try to stop the proceedings, fearing that people would be injured. Although his fears were duly noted, the crowd took no notice of the ash falling onto them and carried on enjoying the concert proceedings.

For multiple names in different languages, use {{lang|[code]|[name]}}. --> | romanized_name = | former_name = | type = Non-governmental research organization | traded_as = | ISIN = | industry = | genre = Sustainable development <!-- Only used with media and publishing companies --> | fate = | predecessor = <!-- or: | predecessors = --> | successor = <!-- or: | successors = --> | founded = [[Zagreb]], [[Croatia]] ({{Start date|2009}}) <!-- if known: {{start date|YYYY|MM|DD}} in [[city]], [[country]] --> | founder = <!-- or: | founders = --> | defunct = <!-- {{end date|YYYY|MM|DD}} --> | hq_location = | hq_location_city = [[Zagreb]] | hq_location_country = [[Croatia]] | num_locations = | num_locations_year = <!-- Year of num_locations data (when known) --> | area_served = <!-- or: | areas_served = --> | key_people = {{unbulleted list|Neven Duić ([[Chairman]])}} | products = | brands = | production = | production_year = <!-- Year of production data (when known) --> | services = | revenue = | revenue_year = <!-- Year of revenue data (when known) --> | operating_income = | income_year = <!-- Year of operating_income data (when known) --> | net_income = <!-- or: | profit = --> | net_income_year = <!-- or: | profit_year = --><!-- Year of net_income/profit data (when known) --> | aum = <!-- Only for financial-service companies --> | assets = | assets_year = <!-- Year of assets data (when known) --> | equity = | equity_year = <!-- Year of equity data (when known) --> | owner = <!-- or: | owners = --> | members = | members_year = <!-- Year of members data (when known) --> | num_employees = | num_employees_year = <!-- Year of num_employees data (when known) --> | parent = | divisions = | subsid = | module = <!-- Used to embed other templates --> | ratio = <!-- Basel III ratio, for BANKS ONLY --> | rating = <!-- credit rating, for BANKS ONLY --> | footnotes = | website = www.sdewes.org <!-- {{URL|www.sdewes.org}} --> }}
'''SDEWES Centre''' ('''The International Centre for Sustainable Development of Energy, Water and Environment Systems)''', is a non-governmental scientific organization based at the [[University of Zagreb]], [[Croatia]].<ref>[http://eai.eu/organization/sdewes-centre European Alliance for Innovation], (retrieved 2015-06-18)</ref><ref>[http://www.wisions.net/posts/wisions-at-the-sdewes-conference-in-dubrovnik-croatia/page:26#post53 Wisions of sustainability], (retrieved 2015-06-18)</ref>
==Mission== SDEWES Centre is dedicated to the improvement and dissemination of knowledge on methods, policies and technologies for increasing the [[Our Common Future|sustainability of development]] by [[Decoupling Natural Resource Use and Environmental Impacts from Economic Growth report|de-coupling growth from natural resources]] and replacing them with [[knowledge-based economy]], taking into account its economic, environmental and social pillars. One of the main issues of the coming decades is to improve efficiencies by integrating various life supporting systems, using [[waste]] from one, as resource in other, and in exact moment when it is beneficial to all, integrating [[power engineering|electricity]], [[HVAC#Heating|heating]], [[cooling]], [[transport]], [[Water supply network|water]], [[Green building|buildings]], [[Industrial ecology|industry]], [[forestry]] and [[agriculture]] systems.
The Centre organizes courses, summer schools, public lectures, seminars and workshops in order to promote [[sustainable development]] of [[Energy development|energy]], [[Water supply network|water]] and [[Human impact on the environment|environment]] systems and provides professional opinion on issues of [[sustainability]] and sustainability metrics. The Centre also organizes a series of international SDEWES conferences for scientists to discuss issues of sustainability of [[Energy development|energy]], [[Water supply network|water]] and [[Human impact on the environment|environment]] system. Through these actions, SDEWES Centre aims to provide a research platform that will provide comprehensive R&D activities, assessment and consultation on the research subjects of sustainable development.<ref>[http://www.worldacademy.org/print/6124 World academy of art and science] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150618115743/http://www.worldacademy.org/print/6124 |date=2015-06-18 }}, (retrieved 2015-05-05)</ref>
==History== SDEWES started as a project co-funded by [[Community Research & Development Information Service|CORDIS]] under the FP5 – INCO 2 programme<ref>[http://cordis.europa.eu/project/rcn/63666_en.html SDEWES project funded by CORDIS] (retrieved 2015-06-17)</ref> in 2002, when first Dubrovnik Conference on [[Sustainable Development]] of [[Energy]], [[Water]] and [[Environment (systems)|Environment]] Systems was organized. Partners in this project were [[University of Zagreb]] and [[Instituto Superior Técnico]] (Lisbon). After the organisation of three more conferences in 2003, 2005 and 2007, SDEWES Centre was established in 2009. Since then, eight more conferences were organized in 2009, 2011, 2012, 2013, 2014, 2015 and 2016. As a separate regional event, the SEE SDEWES Conferences are held every two years, starting with 2014 in Ohrid. The 2nd SEE SDEWES Conference was held in Piran.
== SDEWES-Skopje == New section of SDEWES Centre is established in [[Skopje]], [[Republic of Macedonia|Macedonia]], with the goal to gather professionals and scientists from broad range of disciplines, particularly located in the [[Southeast Europe]], in order to provide scientific support for wise policy-making. SDEWES-Skopje aims to extend the activities at regional level including the other [[EU]] candidate and potential candidate countries, as well as [[EU]] neighbourhood countries to foster regional coordination in providing feasible solutions for the common challenges and gaining synergy effects.
==Membership== According to the Statute of SDEWES Centre, every person can under the same circumstances apply for membership.
==Conferences== Up to 2011, SDEWES Conference was organized as biennial conference in [[Dubrovnik]], [[Croatia]]. From the year 2012, it is an annual event but with a geographic regime. Every two years the conference is held in Dubrovnik, and in the years between on different locations.
The SDEWES 2012 Conference was held in [[Ohrid]], and in 2014 on a cruise ship travelling between [[Venice]] and [[Istanbul]].<ref>[http://www.allconferences.com/c/the-9th-conference-on-sustainable-development-of-energy-water-and-environment-systems-venice-2014-september-20 Global Conference Directory], (retrieved 2015-05-15)</ref>
In 2014, the first regional SEE SDEWES conference was held in [[Ohrid]], [[Republic of Macedonia|Macedonia]] focused on South East Europe.<ref>[http://www.locsee.eu/event.php?id=109 LOCSEE on 1st South East European Conference on Sustainable Development of Energy, Water and Environment Systems - SEE SDEWES Ohrid 2014] (retrieved 2015-06-18)</ref>
In 2015, the 10th Conference on SDEWES was held in [[Dubrovnik]].<ref>[http://www.prepare-net.com/calendar/10th-conference-sustainable-development-energy-water-and-environment-systems-%E2%80%93-sdewes PREPARE - Network of experts in sustainable consumption and production], (retrieved 2015-05-19)</ref> 540 scientists from over 65 countries participated.
In 2016, the second regional SEE SDEWES conference was held in [[Piran]], [[Republic of Slovenia|Slovenia]].<ref>[http://escape26.um.si/see-sdewes-2016-ecos-2016/ Piran conference announced by Escape] (retrieved 2015-10-19)</ref>
Also in 2016, the 11th SDEWES Conference was held in [[Lisbon]], [[Portugal]].<ref>[http://www.wikicfp.com/cfp/servlet/event.showcfp?eventid=49500&copyownerid=82997 Wiki call for papers for SDEWES2016] (retrieved 2015-11-19)</ref>
In 2017, the 12th SDEWES Conference will be held in [[Dubrovnik]].<ref>[http://www.eurec.be/en/News-Events/Calendar/12th-SDEWES-Conference-Dubrovnik-2017/ EUREC announces the 12th SDEWES Conference] (retrieved 2017-03-08)</ref>
In 2018, the 1st LATIN AMERICAN SDEWES Conference will be held in [[Rio de Janeiro]], Brazil.
Work presented at the conferences are published in scientific journals <ref>[http://www.journals.elsevier.com/energy/ Elsevier], (retrieved 2015-06-18)</ref> and among them, in the Journal of Sustainable Development of Energy, Water and Environment Systems <ref>[http://road.issn.org/issn/1848-9257-journal-of-sustainable-development-of-energy-water-and-environment-systems#.VUiKIPntmkp ROAD, Directory of open access scholary resources], (retrieved 2015-05-05)</ref>
==Journal== SDEWES Centre is publishing research [[open access]] Journal of Sustainable Development of Energy, Water and Environment Systems since 2013.
==Research== SDEWES Centre forms research teams from the pool of members to participate in research projects. SDEWES Centre is involved in two [[Seventh Framework Programme|FP7]] projects,<ref>[http://www.s2biom.eu/en/project-partners.html S2Biom project], (retrieved 2015-05-05)</ref><ref>[http://innovereast.eu/en/innover/about/partners INNOVER-EAST project], (retrieved 2015-05-05)</ref> one [[Horizon 2020]] project<ref>[http://cordis.europa.eu/project/rcn/194625_en.html FosterREG project], (retrieved 2015-06-17)</ref> and one project under the [[European integration|European Strategy for Danube Region]] (EUSDR) fund START.
== SDEWES Index == In line with the aims of the SDEWES Center, an index is also developed to benchmark the performance of cities across aspects that are related to energy, water and environment systems. With the namesake of the Center, the SDEWES Index consists of 7 dimensions, 35 indicators, and close to 20 sub-indicators. It is currently applied to 58 cities.<ref>{{Cite web|title = SDEWES Centre - SDEWES Index|url = http://www.sdewes.org/sdewes_index.php|website = www.sdewes.org|accessdate = 2015-10-17}}</ref>
